[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The High Assurance Transformation System (HATS) defines syntax transformation, execution, and result display requirements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: HATS enables SDT parsing, transformation execution, and file management, integrating with HATS-SML and JVM for syntax processing.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: HATS integrates with HATS-SML, JVM, and OS for syntax analysis and execution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: HATS provides a graphical interface with navigation, syntax highlighting, and customization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: HATS supports Java 1.3, HATS-SML, and ML interpreters.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: HATS enables secure process invocation and encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: HATS optimizes memory for SDT processing and execution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: HATS ensures 24/7 availability with error handling and maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: HATS is configurable for workflows, platforms, and transformation logic.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: HATS connects to repositories for transformation retrieval and validation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 MISSING-TAG2: HATS operates on standard PCs and workstations with minimal resources.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: HATS provides syntax parsing, execution, and visualization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: HATS depends on a JVM, HATS-SML integration, and execution permissions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: HATS requires an operational HATS-SML instance, JVM, and system access.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Transformation Execution: Application of syntax rules.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: HATS is for developers, researchers, and engineers handling syntax transformations.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with HATS-SML for syntax parsing and transformation execution.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with OS-level tools for file and process management.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall execute transformation programs and generate SDTs (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall display transformation outputs, including visual and textual formats (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide user-friendly navigation menus and customization options.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process and render SDTs with up to 15,000 nodes in under 5 seconds, depending on system resources.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support simultaneous execution of multiple transformations.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall store parsed files and syntax-related data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall ensure data consistency and maintain file associations.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall meet ESA data standards and ISO 27001 security guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale to handle larger data files dynamically.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log critical actions and events, including transformations and security events.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure cross-platform compatibility and comply with ESA & ISO 27001 security standards.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates transformation workflows, SDT rendering, and compliance with ESA and ISO standards.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, configuration instructions, and API references.
[SEC] 5. References: ESA standards documentation, ISO 27001 guidelines, and HATS-SML manuals.
